p: This article focuses on the role of engineers as technical experts in participatory democracy, but variations of this debate have focused on a range of substantive areas such as the role of intellectuals in public life (Bourdieu, 1989); expert testimony in courts of law (Golan, 2004); economists in development (Easterly, 2014); and the role of corporations in regulatory policymaking (Oreskes & Conway, 2011), among others. The original Lippmann-Dewey debate was about the role of journalists in a democracy.
